CMSC 2\\Introduction to the Internet\\3\\"Tools and services of the Internet

column1: CMSC 11\\Introduction to Computer Science\\3\\"Introduction to the major areas of computer science; software systems and methodology; computer theory; computer organization and architecture. Students learn to write programs using high-level block-structured programming language. Prerequisite: MATH 11 or MATH 17."
CMSC 12\\Foundations of Computer Science\\3\\"An overview of the major areas of computer science. Prerequisite: None."
CMSC 21\\Fundamentals of Programming\\3\\"Introduction to computer programming using a procedural high-level language. Program design
CMSC 22\\Object-Oriented Programming\\3\\"Objects
column2: design and implementation of object-oriented programs. Prerequisite: CMSC 12."

column1: CMSC 23\\Mobile Computing\\3\\"Methods and techniques for developing mobile applications. Prerequisite: CMSC 22."
CMSC 56\\Discrete Mathematical Structures in Computer Science I\\3\\"Principles of logic
column4: Boolean algebra and linear algebra. Prerequisite: None."

column1: CMSC 57\\Discrete Mathematical Structures in Computer Science II\\3\\"Principles of combinatorics
column3: algebraic systems and graph theory. Prerequisite: CMSC 56."

column1: CMSC 100\\Web Programming\\3\\"Design and implementation of web applications. Prerequisite: CMSC 22."
CMSC 123\\Data Structures\\3\\"Abstract data types and implementation; lists
column7: searching and sorting techniques; dynamic storage management. Prerequisites: CMSC 21 & CMSC 57 or COI."

column1: CMSC 124\\Design and Implementation of Programming Languages\\3\\"Study of the fundamental concepts in the design and implementation of current high-level programming languages; syntax and translation; language definition structures; elementary and structured data types; abstraction mechanisms; sequence and data control; run time considerations. Prerequisite: CMSC 123 or COI."
CMSC 125\\Operating Systems\\3\\"Processor management
column6: networks and distributed systems. Prerequisite: CMSC 123 or COI."

column1: CMSC 127\\File Processing and Database Systems\\3\\"Data models: relational
column2: network and hierarchical models; Database management system
column3: data definition and manipulation language; Data security
column6: protection and recovery; Principal database systems and query languages. Prerequisite: CMSC 22 or COI."

column1: CMSC 128\\Introduction to Software Engineering\\3\\"Software life cycle from the requirement specification and design phases through the construction of actual software; topics include planning a software project
column4: implementation and software maintenance. Prerequisite: CMSC 123 or COI."

column1: CMSC 129\\Principles of Compiler Design\\3\\"Fundamental concepts in the design and implementation of compilers: lexical analysis
column4: code generation and optimization. Prerequisite: CMSC 124."

column1: CMSC 130\\Logic Design and Digital Computer Circuits\\3\\"Data representation and computer arithmetic; logic functions and equations; description
column3: and design of combinatorial and sequential circuits; functional properties of digital integrated circuits. Prerequisite: CMSC 57."

column1: CMSC 131\\Introduction to Computer Organization and Machine-Level Programming\\3\\"An introduction to computer organization and interfaces between hardware and software; microcomputer systems; basic compiler organization
column3: interrupt mechanisms; assembly language programming; Machine vs. Assembly vs. High-level language
column10: serial port communications. Prerequisite: CMSC 21 or COI."

column1: CMSC 132\\Computer Architecture\\3\\"Advanced topics in computer systems organization from a designer’s point of view: multiprocessing
column5: techniques for increasing primary memory bandwidths; Modularization
column8: cache and associative memories; Virtual memory; Bus structures; Multiprogramming and time-sharing organizations; Network principles and protocols; Distributed resources. Prerequisite: CMSC 131."

column1: CMSC 137\\Data Communications and Networking\\3\\"Basic principles of data communications; design issues and protocols in the layers of data network; networks for various applications. Prerequisite: CMSC 125."

CMSC 141\\Automata and Language Theory\\3\\"Finite automata and regular languages; push-down automata and context-free languages. Turing machines and enumerable sets: linear-bounded automata and context-free languages
column2: compatibility and the halting problem; undecidable problems; recursive and recursively-enumerable languages and computational complexity. Prerequisite: CMSC 123 or COI."

column1: CMSC 142\\Design and Analysis of Algorithms\\3\\"Algorithm design techniques; use of data structures
column10: lower bounds. NP-completeness. Prerequisite: CMSC 123 or COI."

column1: CMSC 150\\Numerical and Symbolic Computation\\3\\"Computational problem solving; sources of errors in computation; iterative approximation methods and symbolic algebra; mathematical software libraries and symbolic manipulation packages. Prerequisite: MATH 27 or MATH 36
CMSC 161\\Interactive Computer Graphics\\3\\"Graphics systems software and hardware
column11: animation. Students write their 3D rendering engine. Prerequisite: CMSC 123 or COI."

column1: CMSC 165\\Digital Image Processing\\3\\"Methods for acquiring
column5: and analyzing digital images. Prerequisite: CMSC 123 or COI."

column1: CMSC 170\\Introduction to Artificial Intelligence\\3\\"Basic principles and applications of artificial intelligence: knowledge representation
column3: pattern recognition and expert systems. Prerequisite: CMSC 123."

column1: CMSC 172\\Robot Modeling\\3\\"Robotics manipulators and their characteristics; conversion from joint space to real world coordinates; inverse kinematics; workspace analysis; differential motion. Prerequisite: CMSC 123."
CMSC 173\\Human-Computer Interaction\\3\\"Theory
column3: and programming practices in Human-Computer Interaction. Prerequisites: CMSC 123 and STAT 101."
